summary: Woodstock was a famous music festival that took place in 1969 in New York. It was held on a farm and lasted for three days, with over 460,000 people attending. Many popular musicians performed, even though the weather was not great. Woodstock became a symbol of the 1960s counterculture and is considered a super important moment in music history. It was so significant that it was made into a movie and inspired songs. People still celebrate Woodstock's anniversary, and the site is now a historic place.
title: Woodstock
